intro: Benthamantha mollis, commonly known as the silky benthamantha, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
